message: Hey team!:rocket: Can you believe it's been 8 fantastic years for Online Boutique?
Before we dive into anniversary celebrations, let's give a warm welcome to Maya, our new Security Analyst. She's got 5 years of cybersecurity expertise under her belt! :clap:
Hi everyone! :raised_hand_with_fingers_splayed: Thrilled to be here, especially on such a special occasion. Let's make Online Boutique even successful and secure together!
Welcome, Maya! Your experience will elevate our cybersecurity efforts.
Excited to have you, Maya! Bez has been very excited to have you on the team.
Impressive! Eager to learn from you, Maya.
:+1: Welcome Maya, pleasure meeting you.
Hi Maya! Your experience is top-notch. Cheers to you and to Online Boutique's 8-year anniversary! :partying_face: :tada:
Thanks for the warm welcome! Excited for the celebration and our anniversary party.
Start lvl 18
Clicked Start button
We are all so glad you have joined us Maya
Hold on, team. Quick check-in. Is anyone else experiencing internet problems or slow connectivity?
Internet's definitely sluggish, was loading up github and it took ages to load
Perhaps it could be due to the increase of sales we have been having with this anniversary sale?
Hey team, we've seen some weird traffic from our data centre network in the last couple of days, it's been mostly minor but never as bad compared to now although
Hamed and I will have been monitoring outbound traffic. Checking for anomalies again.
I will try to place an order and check the platform.
Just ran a test on my internet speed.
the infected switch has been successfully changed over
Good job, can we confirm @Conail Tierney?
Cheers, everyone! Resolving these network issues added a bit of spice to our celebration
Good job team! We managed to keep the anniversary vibe alive despite the detour.
High-fives all around!  I will take out that faulty switch as soon as possible.
The website's performance is looking solid again
The anniversary orders are flowing smoothly now. No hiccups on the code side.
Our customers are back to enjoying the celebration. Happy customers, happy anniversary!
Really great job @Conail Tierney.
Special congratulations to our Incident Manager for steering the ship with finesse and to Maya for your help identifying the faulty switch. Cheers to a remarkable team! :tada:
Start drill retro and feedback
Start Drill
Clicked Start button
So, business wise, we are on target for this months sales. Having said that we are too close to the target. We need every penny of every minute to stay on course.
Please make sure systems are healthy so we can hit target.
Welcome to the team @Gamunu Balagalla. everone is here to help, how are you finding things so far?
@Tinus we're starting to get some mixed reports of customers not able to access the site, can your team investigate?
Yes @Gamunu Balagalla is incident manager today, Gamunu Balagalla can you drive this?
Hey folks, what is going on? I can see a big drop on payments hitting our accounts
it could be a load issue
Hey, team, how are we doing?
There were a few deployments this morning
I'm at your service
I'm online too
What do I need to tell the angry customers?
yes Tinus will keep you updated in the business comms channel
Daniel what were the deployments, were you involved in the changes?
Bob, how many customers are impacted? What are they reporting?
I made changes to the frontend service

Reports are coming in from various locations indicating widespread issues with the frontend. Customers are experiencing difficulties with navigation and checkout. We're seeing a high volume of tickets on this.
ok Daniel can you look into the changes you made and verify everything is working? maybe run quick sanity test
I'll check the frontend service and report back shortly.
Bob are the reports coming from all regions? or specific to UK?
The reports of issues are widespread, not limited to any specific region.
Tanya can you check the change CHG89350?
*Incident Number INC100056:* SEV-1 incident, frontend down.
Will do. I'll review the payment service changes and get back to you.
team is investigating the cause of the issue and will provide an update in 5min
Daniel please update us with your findings
Review complete and frontend looks unhealthy at the moment
Bob keep eye on the business comms. I will update you about the progress in there so you can keep the customers informed
thanks will do.
confirmed the issue is with frontend and we are working on a resolution, next update in 3
Daniel Shay can you revert the changes, before you do, is it safe to rollback?
Tanya can you provide your finding on the payment change?
Which changes should we revert first?
Payment service looks healthy
the frontend changes, CHG89348. Can you confirm whether it is safe to rollback?
Thank you Tanya, in the meantime can you also check the infra status.
yea i think it is safe to rollback the changes
I'll check the infrastructure status and get back to you.
Daniel please revert the changes, keep us posted on the progress
Rollback already initiated for CHG89348, monitoring the situation.
the change CHG89348 is cause of the incident and we are reverting the changes, the services will be restored soon.
I can see the user activity returning to normal
Bob can you confirm the issue is resolved?
Shay can you run a quick sanity test to confirm the rollback
Start drill retro and feedback
Customers are now able to use the site and place orders.
Thank you Bob
The issue is resovled. rollback of the CHG89348 restored the service
Thanks so much for helping to resolve this! Make sure to communicate the resolution in business channel.
Daniel make sure, to find a root cause before re-deploying the change.
Thanks all

thanks Tanya

Hamed you online?
Network is looking good, I don't see any alerts or any sort of errors in our monitoring system.

thanks Tanya
Daniel any update?
I think the frontend service is having issues after the changes we did.
can we investigate the change CHG89348, roll it back if its safe to do so
Ok, I will keep customers posted on the progress. Thank you!
Daniel you there?
Frontend down from recent changes that were made to the services
yes, frontend changes are safe to roll back.
Daniel rollback frontend changes
Rollback for the frontend service has been executed.
Bob can you check with the customers?
@danei
Daniel can you check the status of the frontend?
platform is back working for me
performed rollback of frontend change
platform is back online
Frontend running smoothly, orders are coming through :thumbsup:
thanks, Bob any update?
Customers are reporting they can access the website now, everything is looking good. :thumbsup:
The frontend service looks healthy.
good
Customers are reporting that they can access the platform now.
well done team
reports coming in from customers, platform is back online for everyone

So, business wise, we are on target for this months sales. Having said that we are too close to the target. We need every penny of every minute to stay on course.
All departments please make sure we are doing all we can to hit the target.
For marketing folks, it means: be creative with targeting advertisement channels that have most return.
for merchandise team: be on trend and bring kool products on the site.
for IT: smooth user experience and availability.
Any questions?
I'm a bit concerned with the load levels we see. From experience IT systems fail unpredictably in the face of load. so be vigilant

One question boss
Shoot
How close are we exactly to the budget?
